alert.note: Alert for Cibola; McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 10:18AM MST until February 22 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northwestern Cibola County in west central New Mexico... McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Southwestern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Northwestern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... Southeastern San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 1100 AM MST. * At 1016 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Coolidge, or 11 miles northwest of Thoreau extending northeast toward US 550 and Cuba, moving rapidly toward the east and northeast. HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 1 and 68. Highway 550 between Mile Markers 54 and 129. Locations impacted include... Gallup, Zuni Pueblo, Cuba, Thoreau, Crownpoint, Nakaibito, Nageezi, Vanderwagen, Yah-Ta-Hey and Counselor. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Avoid or delay travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents.

area.areaDesc: Cibola; McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval
